intro: Adenoropium mutabile, commonly known as the variable adenocephalum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are pink or purple in color. Adenoropium mutabile is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its striking appearance.
